title: Aerobrake
simpleExplanation: Uses the atmosphere at the destination to slow down the craft.

advancedExplanations.content: Each checkpoint can individually be set to use aerobraking (if that checkpoint has an atmosphere). In the 'Preferences' section of the 'Mission Checkpoints' panel, you can set aerobraking as a default technique to reduce delta-v requirements.
This is typically advantageous when slowing down the craft, e.g. to capture into orbit from an intercepting trajectory, or lowering the craft's highly elliptical orbit down to a low orbit.
Aerobraking at Duna can reduce delta-v requirements

title: Trip Details
simpleExplanation: Step by step breakdown showing what the craft needs to do, to get to the destination.

advancedExplanations.content: Tap the delta-v value between 2 checkpoints to view the delta-v cost for intermediary steps. This will take into account any configuration (e.g. Aerobraking or 0% Plane Changes) to show how the delta-v cost was derived.

title: Checkpoint Mode
simpleExplanation: Add single checkpoints, or enable checkpoint mode to add many.

advancedExplanations.content: Tap the green add checkpoint button, then tap a planet to add a single checkpoint.
Tap the green lock button to enable checkpoint mode, then tap multiple planets to add checkpoints to them. To disable checkpoint mode, tap the green lock button again.

title: Route Type
simpleExplanation: Sets the preferred type of route that will be used during calculations.

advancedExplanations.content: The 'Direct' route type will attempt to find a simple trip with the least amount of intermediary steps. When going from Moho to Duna, it will attempt a planetary transfer directly to Duna.

The 'Efficient' route type will prefer trips with the least amount of delta-v required. When going from Moho to Duna, it will suggest the following trip 'Moho->Eve->Kerbin->Duna' because that is cheaper, although such trips will take much longer to complete.

title: Plane Change Cost
simpleExplanation: Sets the ratio used for calculations regarding plane changes.

advancedExplanations.content: When transferring between planets or moons with different orbital inclinations, the craft will likely need to correct for the by expending extra delta-v.
Generally, the more patient a trip plan is to launch during the correct launch window, the less delta-v is required to correct for this.

title: Remove Checkpoint
simpleExplanation: Checkpoints can be deleted, individually, or as an entire mission.

advancedExplanations.content: In the 'Mission Checkpoints' panel, tap the red trash can beside a checkpoint to delete that checkpoint. The mission will assume to skip that checkpoint, make a new connection in it's place, and re-calculate the other checkpoints for a new result.
Tap the red trashcan below the list to remove all checkpoints from the mission. This will clear the list to let you start a new mission.
